snippet: The president moved closer to allowing American forces to again directly battle the Taliban in what is expected to be an especially bloody summer fighting season.
abstract: Pres Obama loosens restrictions on American forces' use of airstrikes and ground combat against Taliban, moving step closer to once again allowing United States military to battle group directly; move points to ongoing difficulty of ending America's role in region and Afghan army's inability to fight militants itself.
lead_paragraph: The president moved closer to allowing American forces to again directly battle the Taliban in what is expected to be an especially bloody summer fighting season.

headline.main: Obama Loosens Restrictions on U.S. Forces Fighting Taliban in Afghanistan
